description.narrative: Stödet till CDRI är ett icke-öronmärkt stöd men med speciell betoning på forskningsprogram om demokratisk samhällsstyrning, jämlik tillväxt, klimatförändringar och kunskapsutveckling.
The support to CDRI ia a core support but with special emphasis on research programmes on democratic governance, inclusive growth, climate change and skills development.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: During the intervention period CDRI successfully implemented core elements of its Cambodia 2020 Research Strategy.
Each research unit has included gender issues and analysis in its research projects. Among the 40 staff who graduated with master’s degrees or PhDs in 2011-2016, 20 were female. Gender equity principles were integrated into CDRI’s research strategy, programme and associated capacity development for researchers. The numbers of participants in seminars and workshops have met CDRI’s expectations and feedback on the organisation and content of the seminars and workshops has been very favourable.
Citations of CDRI research have increased significantly. In 2011, 179 people cited CDRI research findings, in 2015 it was 450. During the implementing period CDRI has published high-quality Khmer language and Cambodia-relevant research products in all major programmes and projects.
CDRI engaged six research interest groups in the annual research symposium in 2015. CDRI successfully conducted 130 consultation and dissemination conferences, workshops and seminars during the implementation period. Key areas that emerged from these discussions include science, technology, and innovation, the drivers of a nation’s innovative capacity and global competitiveness.
CDRI and partners successfully conducted five annual outlook conferences in 2011-2015. CDRI published an outlook brief from each conference. CDRI researchers participated in a number of regional and international events: 52 workshops in the region, 39 in Europe, eight in the USA, five in Africa, one in Panama, three in Canada and 10 in China. Researchers attended 72 national and 128 sub-national workshops.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
